greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle, square of A051731.
comment: Eigensequence of the triangle = A007557; i.e., sequence A007557 shifts to the left upon multiplication by A127170. - _Gary W. Adamson_, Apr 27 2009
T(n,k) is also the number of divisors of n that are divisible by k, with n>=1 and 1<=k<=n (see also A195050). - _Omar E. Pol_, Mar 30 2015
formula: Square of A051731 A000005, d(n); in every column k, interspersed with (k-1) zeros.
T(n,k) = A000005(n/k), if k divides n, otherwise 0, with n>=1 and 1<=k<=n. - _Omar E. Pol_, Apr 01 2015
example: First 10 rows of the triangle are:
program: (PARI) tabl(nn) = {m = matrix(nn, nn, n, k, if ((n % k) == 0, 1, 0)); m = m^2; for (n=1, nn, for (k=1, n, print1(m[n, k], ", ");); print(););} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Apr 01 2015
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Jan 06 2007
ext: 8 terms taken from Example section and then corrected in Data section by _Omar E. Pol_, Mar 30 2015
Extended beyond a(21) by _Omar E. Pol_, Apr 01 2015
